meanings.definition: The act of mutualizing or becoming mutualized.
meanings.sent1: The mutualization of the organization led to shared ownership.
meanings.sent2: The mutualization of the company resulted in equal participation from all members.
meanings.sent3: The mutualization of the team made everyone feel like they were part of a big family.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a mutualization of joy and relief after the successful project.
meanings.sent5: The mutualization of responsibilities among the group made the workload lighter for everyone.

meanings.definition: The process of converting a company or organization into a mutual company.
meanings.sent1: The mutualization of the firm brought about a more inclusive business model.
meanings.sent2: After the mutualization, the company's profits were shared among all members.
meanings.sent3: The mutualization of the business turned it into a cooperative venture.
meanings.sent4: The mutualization of the corporation transformed it into a community-driven entity.
meanings.sent5: The mutualization of the organization created a sense of unity among its employees.
